results.title: Papua and New Guinea development
results.creator_credit: Douglas White, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the immense potential and the industrial expansion of Papua New Guinea. Full economic development of the territory is an exercise in cooperation between the people themselves, the Administration and private investors.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Douglas White, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Papua and New Guinea Command
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Papua and New Guinea Command, recruited from indigenous peoples, is seen as a means of promoting unity in the Territory by bringing recruits from all regions together on an equal footing in a common force. Scenes of recruiting and military training are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Paper chain
results.brief_description: Shows the entire processes involved in the production of quality paper at one of Wiggins Teape many paper mills. Three types of raw material, old rags, wood pulp, and esparto grass are used. Shows special treatment for special types of paper and the innumerable uses of paper in all walks of life, and the extraordinary situation which would exist without paper.

results.title: Pantomime - Fairy Tale Theatre
results.brief_description: This program takes a look at the magical world of pantomime, both on the stage and behind it, and meets some of the artists who have made panto their life’s work.

results.title: Panorama: cancer
results.brief_description: Discusses the nature of cancer, the facts which research has revealed and stresses the need to intensify clinical research. Prevention is important and must be publicised particularly the need to reduce smoking. Suggests forming a central international clearing house for data on cancer to speed its control.
results.description: Discusses the nature of cancer, the facts which research has revealed and stresses the need to intensify clinical research. results.title: Pandora's box
results.brief_description: A delightful experiment in social satire. A large box floats into view, then begins to revolve and change shape. Doors open and close to reveal quick snatches in color of zooming airplanes, TV commercials, silent movies, a mouth spouting gobbledygook, and, finally a loop of film which is eaten by the box in one gulp. Is the box our world?

results.title: Pancho
results.brief_description: From the book written and illustrated by Berta and Elmer Hader, this animated story tells of a young Mexican boy, Pancho, who unexpectedly becomes a hero when he captures a bull.

results.title: Pan-Pacific jamboree
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Presents a scout’s account of activities at an International Boy Scout Jamboree held near Melbourne. He mentions the friends he makes, demonstrates folk dancing given by groups of scouts, daily chores, the big parade and popular past-times such as autograph hunting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Herschells Films
